newsitem.title: CANADA: Quebec's 1997/98 spending estimates out March 18.
newsitem.headline: Quebec's 1997/98 spending estimates out March 18.

text.p: Quebec Treasury Board President Jacques Leonard said on Friday that the Quebec government will release its 1997/98 spending estimates at 1415 EST/1915 GMT on March 18.
The estimates are expected to show expenditure cuts of C$2.6 billion as the Parti Quebecois government strives to meet its forecast of a C$2.2 billion budget deficit for fiscal 1997/98.
No revenue or deficit figures are provided with the release of the spending estimates. Quebec generally releases its spending estimates a few days before introducing the full budget.
An official date for the introduction of Quebec's full 1997/98 budget has not been set, but speculation is that the government will choose March 25.
